thread.title: Firefighters Battle Apartment Fire In Oakland
thread.title_full: Firefighters Battle Apartment Fire In Oakland

author: CBS Pittsburgh
title: Firefighters Battle Apartment Fire In Oakland
text:
Firefighters Battle Apartment Fire In Oakland January 29, 2017 8:08 PM Filed Under: Joe Hammer Square , Lynne Hayes-Freeland , Oakland 
PITTSBURGH (KDKA) â€” Firefighters were called to an apartment in Oakland on Sunday. 
Around 7:50 p.m., crews began battling a 3-alarm fire in the 3000 block of Joe Hammer Square, an area very heavily populated by students. 
Officials say flames spread from one building to a building next door. 
Firefighters were initially concerned, believing there were five people living inside the building and only being able to find four. 
By 8:45 p.m., officials confirmed all occupants were able to escape safely and no one was injured. 
One female was treated on-scene by medics. 
It is not clear what sparked the fire. 
This is a developing story, stay with KDKA and KDKA.com for more information.
